"EXPECTATION FOR ALL EMPLOYEES

	Support the organization’s mission, vision and values by adhering to the behavioral standards of Bay Area Hospital. Effective communication skills and the ability work effectively with people from various backgrounds are critical.

POSITION SUMMARY

	Collects objective patient data, provides patient care and comfort measures within scope of practice and as assigned by a licensed nurse. Reports observations of patient and outcome of data-gathering and care activities to licensed nurse. Documents appropriately in medical record.

PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
	(Essential job requirements listed in bold)

• Understands the CNA2-Acute scope of practice and accepts assignments from licensed nurse consistent with scope of practice
	• Gathers patient data – vital signs, height and weight, intake, output, pain levels; uses appropriate powered and manual equipment to gather data (e.g. electronic vital signs monitors, digital scales)
	• Obtains specimens (within scope of practice); performs point-of-care tests for capillary blood glucose, occult blood, urine screening, other point-of-care tests within scope of practice and for which competency has been demonstrated and documented
	• Assists patient with activities of daily living – personal care/grooming, mobility, nutrition and hydration, skin care, elimination, use of assistive devices, range of motion exercises, positioning. Employs safe patient handling equipment as needed.
	• Assists with complementary therapies for pain relief
	• Performs other tasks as assigned, e.g. applying sequential compression devices, assisting with warm/cold therapies, bladder scanning, reinforcing use of incentive spirometer, assisting with
	turning/coughing/deep breathing exercises, emptying drainage devices, applying and removing restraints
	• Answers patient call lights, promptly reports patient requests outside of CNA2 Acute scope of practice to licensed nurse
	• Communicates clearly, completely, and concisely to licensed nurse regarding physical status of patient, care and comfort measures delivered, data collected, changes in patient condition, observations, and patient statements about condition or care
• Documents care and observations in medical record clearly, accurately, and in a timely manner
	• Places leads and electrodes for telemetry
	• Works with the unit team to ensure cupboards are appropriately stocked, work areas and patient carerooms/areas are tidy and free of clutter, halls are clear"
